title: Topological magnons in a collinear altermagnet
authors: Meng-Han Zhang and Lu Xiao and Dao-Xin Yao
abstract:
We propose a model with Weyl magnons and weak topological magnons
($\mathbb{Z}_2$) in a collinear altermagnet on the honeycomb lattice.
Altermagnetic magnon bands can be realized by breaking the symmetry of the
second nearest neighbor exchange couplings without the Dzyaloshinskii-Moriya
(DM) interaction. Besides the Chern number and $\mathbb{Z}_2$ invariant,
chirality is important to describe the band topology. The model shows the
nonzero magnon Nernst effect for both the strong and weak topological phases
when a longitudinal temperature gradient exists. Furthermore, we find the
orbital angular momentum induced purely by the topology of magnons, which can
be probed by the Einstein-de Haas effect.
